intro: Trochera microlaena, commonly known as the small-leaved trochera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
